summary: The Credit for Caring Act of 2025 proposes a tax credit for working family caregivers.  Eligible caregivers, individuals with earned income exceeding $7,500, can claim a credit equal to 30% of qualified expenses exceeding $2,000, up to a maximum of $5,000.  Qualified expenses include those for care recipients with long-term care needs (e.g., spouses, relatives), as certified by a health care practitioner. The credit phases out based on modified adjusted gross income.
